channel.title: Ikov?
channel.description: I always wondered how did iKov become so popular? ... Arent they a leech off of Arrav ? ... :/ and what makes soulsplit so popular too..

item.title: Ikov?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:37, topic:541746”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=660613.msg4419288#msg4419288 date=1397598622]

How much did you make or lose then? Out of curiosity.

I’m not going to say but assure you it wasn’t actually that much, not as much as Arrav made when I was with them; matter of fact, not even close to as much as Arrav made but it really doesn’t matter how much we made…

Basically you guys invested tons of cash and didn’t get a return?

It implies that they got a bit of profit, but not like thousands like you guys are thinking.
[/quote]
Glad someone understands… -.-[/quote]
I blame the server. Players probably didn’t see the value in donating.

Read full topic

item.title: Ikov?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:30, topic:541746”][quote author=sertan8 link=topic=660613.msg4419233#msg4419233 date=1397571344]

Oh well ikov died lmao
http://ikov.org/

They should have paid Jagex too lmao

Aahahaha. Oh wow. This is so hilarious. I feel good actually. They somehow deserved it. Reading through all this just let me conclude that they nearly shit their pants when they got an e-mail by some Jagex worker.

Somehow I have the feeling, that Jagex is on a ‘hunt’, because just a month ago a couple of RSPS has been shutdown.

you feel good? lol youre just jealous. and would the owner really care? he has probably made k’s of $$$
[/quote]
We didn’t make that much…[/quote]
How much did you make or lose then? Out of curiosity.

Read full topic

I can deal with the community but that takes time as I’m sure you and many others know.

item.title: Ikov?
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r
item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

Sure, advertising a leeched PI can gain short-term success in terms of player base magnitude but, for longevity, consistent flow of revenue, and a stable 80/20 player ratio [ideally you would want 80% of your player base to be returning users and 20% consisting of newer players], it would take a lot more than some flashy advertisements.

The influx of users created by the massive advertisements doesn’t necessarily guarantee that those players will return. What does create a need to return however is a wide arrangement of enjoyable content that is consistently being improved and a community that is relative to the player [meaning a troll is more likely to stay within a trolling environment] which Ikov and Soulsplit seem to be doing well.

Read full topic
